The promise is made on condition that the united prayers of the church are offered, and in answer to these prayers there may be expected a power greater than that which comes in answer to private prayer. The power given will be proportionate to the unity of the members and their love for God and for one another.--Letter 32, 1903, p. 5. (To Brother and Sister Farnsworth, January 28, 1903.) 

White Estate Washington, D. C. October 22, 1979
